title: New skatepark opens as part of £730k investment
title_page: Matlock: New skatepark opens as part of £730k investment - BBC News
maintext:
A new skatepark that forms part of a £730,000 investment in a Derbyshire town has opened to the public.
The facility at Matlock's Hall Leys Park replaces the 20-year-old wooden skatepark which had required "constant maintenance" in recent years.
Derbyshire Dales District Council said the new site was the second of three projects being built in the park.
Council leader Steve Flitter said: "It was fantastic to see so many young people using the new facility on day one."
